News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Q3 FY26 Results
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries posted standalone net profit of ₹30.04 crore in Q3 FY26 versus loss of ₹63.47 crore in Q3 FY25. Consolidated revenue declined to ₹64.79 crore from ₹65.49 crore year-on-year.

News.Title: Frontier Warehousing Launches Open Offer for 26% Stake in Kesoram Industries at ₹5.48 per Share
News.Summary: Frontier Warehousing Limited has triggered a mandatory open offer to acquire up to 8.07 crore equity shares representing 26% of Kesoram Industries' voting share capital at ₹5.48 per share, totaling ₹244.26 crores. This follows Frontier's agreement to purchase 42.80% stake from Kesoram's promoter group including Manav Investment and Trading Co. Ltd. and Pilani Investment and Industries Corporation Ltd. at ₹4 per share.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Net Loss of ₹239 Crore for Six Months Ended September 2025
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries Limited's Board approved unaudited financial results for the quarter and six months ended September 30, 2025. The company reported a standalone net loss of ₹111.86 crore for the quarter and ₹239.18 crore for the six-month period. On a consolidated basis, the net loss was ₹25.87 crore for the quarter and ₹125.21 crore for six months. The company recorded exceptional items of ₹108.10 crore in the quarter, primarily due to impairment provisions on investment and loans to its subsidiary Cygnet Industries Limited. Revenue from operations remained nil for standalone operations, while consolidated revenue was ₹55.17 crore for the quarter. The company operates in Rayon, Transparent Paper and Chemicals segments following the demerger of its cement division. Basic and diluted earnings per share from continuing operations was negative ₹3.60 for the quarter and negative ₹7.70 for six months on a standalone basis.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Appoints Sameer Kumar Ray as Chief Financial Officer
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries Limited appointed Sameer Kumar Ray as Chief Financial Officer effective August 18, 2025. The appointment was approved by the company's Board of Directors during their meeting held on the same date. Ray is a qualified Chartered Accountant with twenty-four years of overall experience. The board meeting commenced at 4:25 p.m. and concluded at 5:15 p.m.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Seeks Shareholder Approval for CEO Re-appointment via Postal Ballot
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has issued a postal ballot notice seeking shareholder approval for the re-appointment of Radhakrishnan Padmalochanan as Whole-time Director and CEO for one year, effective August 8, 2025. The remote e-voting period runs from August 6 to September 4, 2025, with results to be announced by September 6, 2025. The proposed remuneration remains unchanged at Rs 5.29 crores per annum plus allowances. Following the demerger of the cement business completed on March 1, 2025, the company reported no operational profit for FY 2024-25, though it recorded a one-time demerger gain of Rs 5,675.63 crores. The board considers Radhakrishnan's continued leadership essential for post-demerger restructuring and managing subsidiary operations in rayon, transparent paper, and chemicals. Radhakrishnan, a chartered accountant who joined the company in 2014, has been serving as CEO since August 2019 and holds 624 equity shares in the company.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Increased Q1 Net Loss
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has reported its Q1 financial results. The company's revenue decreased to 610 million rupees from 673 million rupees in the same quarter last year. The consolidated net loss widened to 1 billion rupees, compared to a loss of 620.2 million rupees in the previous year's corresponding quarter.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries to Consider Q4 Results on April 25
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has announced that it will consider and approve its financial results for the fourth quarter on April 25.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries: Morgan Stanley Sells 19 Lakh Shares at Discount
News.Summary: Morgan Stanley sold 19.30 lakh shares of Kesoram Industries for Rs 81 lakh at Rs 4.20 per share, an 11% discount from the previous closing price. The stock closed at Rs 4.50, down 4.26%. Other significant block deals occurred, with Mundhra Homes, Devi Traders, and Ishaan Tradefin also selling shares.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries: Q3 FY25 Loss Widens by 40.65% YoY
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries reported Q3 FY25 results with a loss of ₹69.17 crore, up 40.65% YoY. Revenue decreased by 1.39% to ₹65.49 crore. Operating income improved by 29.22% QoQ and 16.8% YoY. EPS declined to ₹-0.59, down 37.21% YoY. Market cap stands at ₹6348.1 crore.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Reduced EBITDA Loss in Q3
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has reported an EBITDA loss of 60 million rupees for the third quarter, showing an improvement from the 90 million rupee loss in the same period last year. This represents a reduction in losses by 33.33% year-over-year.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Q3 Revenue Decline
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has reported a revenue of 655 million rupees for the third quarter, compared to 664 million rupees in the same period last year, indicating a slight year-over-year decline.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Increased Q3 Net Loss
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has reported a consolidated net loss of 690 million rupees for the third quarter, compared to a loss of 489 million rupees in the same period last year. This represents an increase in the company's net loss year-over-year.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Q2 Revenue Decline
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has reported a revenue of 587 million rupees for the second quarter, compared to 599 million rupees in the same period last year, indicating a year-over-year decrease.

News.Title: Kesoram Industries Reports Increased Q2 Net Loss
News.Summary: Kesoram Industries has reported a consolidated net loss of 699 million rupees for the second quarter. This represents an increase in losses compared to both the previous year (587 million rupees) and the previous quarter (613 million rupees).
